author: dingmeng-xue
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Write a descriptive title.
- [X] Make sure you are able to repro it on the [latest released version](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases)
- [X] Search the existing issues.
- [X] Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- [X] Refer to [Differences between Windows PowerShell 5.1 and PowerShell](https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/whats-new/differences-from-windows-powershell).

### Steps to reproduce

Below is the output of paths of PowerShell module
```
PS C:\Dev >  $env:PSModulePath -split ';'
C:\Users\dummy\Documents\PowerShell\Modules
C:\Program Files\PowerShell\Modules
c:\dev\powershell-7.2.1-win-x64\Modules
C:\Program Files\WindowsPowerShell\Modules
C:\WINDOWS\system32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\Modules
C:\Program Files (x86)\Microsoft Azure Information Protection\Powershell
```

I **created** folder `MicrosoftGraph` under folder modules and copy/paste `Microsoft.Graph` modules to that folder. `Get-Module` shows me module is there.

```
PS C:\Dev >  get-module Microsoft* -ListAvailable

    Directory: C:\Users\dummy\Documents\PowerShell\Modules\MicrosoftGraph

ModuleType Version    PreRelease Name                                PSEdition ExportedCommands
---------- -------    ---------- ----                                --------- ----------------
Script     1.11.0                Microsoft.Graph.Applications        Core,Desk {Add-MgApplicationKey, Add-MgApplicationPassword, Add-MgServicePrincipalKey, Ad…
Script     1.11.0                Microsoft.Graph.Authentication      Core,Desk {Connect-MgGraph, Disconnect-MgGraph, Get-MgContext, Get-MgProfile…}
Script     1.4.2                 Microsoft.Graph.Users               Core,Desk {Get-MgUser, Get-MgUserCreatedObject, Get-MgUserCreatedObjectByRef, Get-MgUserD…
......
```




### Expected behavior

Not sure whether module can be imported or not. If no, why do those modules show up under that folder? I do the similar thing for Azure PowerShell module. I created folder Az and put all Azure PowerShell under folder Az. But `Get-Module Az* -ListAvailable` cannot show them.

Original question comes from https://github.com/Azure/azure-powershell/issues/19246


### Actual behavior

But those module cannot be imported. The error is below

```console
PS C:\Dev> import-module MicrosoftGraph\Microsoft.Graph
import-module : The specified module 'Microsoft.Graph.Authentication' with version '1.11.0' was not loaded because no valid module file was found in any module directory.
At line:1 char:1
+ import-module MicrosoftGraph\Microsoft.Graph
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : ResourceUnavailable: (Microsoft.Graph.Authentication:String) [Import-Module], FileNotFoundException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : Modules_ModuleWithVersionNotFound,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.ImportModuleCommand
```


### Error details

_No response_

### Environment data

```powershell
PS C:\Dev >  $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.2.1
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.2.1
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.22000
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
```


### Visuals

_No response_
title: Question about correct folder storing modules
